title: What Is Haram in the Islamic Faith?

steps.title: “Haram” is anything considered forbidden within the Muslim faith.
steps.content: “Haram” is anything considered forbidden within the Muslim faith. The concept of haram applies to any number of things in a Muslim’s daily life, from what they can eat and drink to what they can watch and what they can say. Ultimately, the sole authority on what is and isn’t haram is Allah, the singular God and divine authority of the Muslim faith. [1] X Research source

steps.title: “Halal” is anything that’s safe and allowed within the Muslim faith.
steps.content: “Halal” is anything that’s safe and allowed within the Muslim faith. This term is often associated with different foods and beverages. While halal can most certainly apply to what a Muslim eats or drinks, it covers a much wider scope of practices when it comes to a Muslim’s daily life. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Alcohol
steps.content: Alcohol Drinking beer, wine, or alcohol of any type is considered haram. The Quran directly condemns alcohol since it impacts a person’s frame of mind. [3] X Research source Alcohol is only halal in food if it’s completely cooked out of the dish. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Specific meats
steps.content: Specific meats Meats that don’t qualify as haram need to be blessed properly in order to be halal. [5] X Research source According to the Quran, Muslims aren’t allowed to eat: Pigs and boars (or any swine) Animals that eat other animals Poisonous fish Cuts of meat that still contain blood Amphibians Hawks (or any birds of prey) Bugs [6] X Research source

steps.title: Intentionally skipping Ramadan fasts
steps.content: Intentionally skipping Ramadan fasts Practicing Ramadan is a sacred and essential part of practicing the Muslim faith. If you skip a fast without having a proper excuse (e.g., being elderly, being pregnant, etc.), your actions are considered haram. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Doing drugs
steps.content: Doing drugs Like alcohol, doing any type of drug impacts your ability to think clearly. [8] X Research source An exception to this is a product like CBD, which doesn’t have any psychoactive (mind-altering) effects. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Gambling
steps.content: Gambling Gambling is denounced in the Quran and is considered haram due to the many negative effects it can have on a person’s life, like: [10] X Research source Tearing apart families Hindering a follower’s reliance on Allah Encouraging deviant behavior

steps.title: Getting tattoos
steps.content: Getting tattoos Getting any kind of tattoo is seen as haram, since it involves adjusting and changing the human body, which is a creation of Allah. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Gossiping
steps.content: Gossiping Although gossip can seem like a casual, daily occurrence, it qualifies as a serious faith within Islam. The Muslim faith acknowledges how gossip can be very hurtful to other people, and how some people downplay the severity of it. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Idolizing others
steps.content: Idolizing others It’s considered haram to put anyone or anything on a pedestal above Allah.

steps.title: Lying
steps.content: Lying Lying is viewed as haram within Islam in most cases. The Quran speaks out against lying and explains how lying can contribute to an immoral and unholy life. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Masturbating and watching porn
steps.content: Masturbating and watching porn Purity and chastity are important virtues in the Muslim faith, so masturbation is considered haram for both men and women. [14] X Research source Similarly, watching pornography for any reason is viewed as haram, and is an act that requires repentance. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Smoking
steps.content: Smoking Smoking is well-established to be bad for the human body and is associated with risks like cancer, COPD, heart disease, and more. [16] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Islam condemns any action that inflicts harm on others, including yourself. When one buys cigarettes or tobacco products, they’re ultimately purchasing something that has the potential to hurt themselves (while squandering money that could’ve gone to a better cause). [17] X Research source

steps.title: Stealing
steps.content: Stealing Theft is viewed as haram in Islam, and is discussed in-depth within the Quran. The holy text even outlines the proper punishment for someone found guilty of theft, and what processes should be taken depending on the circumstances. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Wearing certain clothes
steps.content: Wearing certain clothes In the Islamic faith, men cannot wear clothing made from translucent materials, or clothing that’s similar to what non-practicing Muslims wear. [19] X Research source Women are expected to wear non-translucent garments that conceal all of their body and aren’t especially decorative. [20] X Research source Men and women are not allowed to cross-dress in the Muslim faith, either.

steps.title: Adultery
steps.content: Adultery Cheating on one’s spouse is extremely taboo in Islam, and is explicitly forbidden within the Quran. [21] X Research source In the Muslim faith the act of adultery is viewed as haram, as well as any actions or steps that a person takes prior to physically cheating on their spouse. [22] X Research source Adultery is considered “zina” within Islam. Zina literally translates to “immorality,” and is associated with inappropriate sexual acts. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Premarital sex
steps.content: Premarital sex Getting intimate with a partner before legal marriage is considered to be haram, and is highly frowned upon within the Muslim faith. Marriage is a very important aspect of Islamic faith, so any intimacy before marriage isn’t allowed. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Women marrying non-Muslim men
steps.content: Women marrying non-Muslim men In the Islamic faith, it’s considered haram for a Muslim woman to marry a man who practices a religion that isn’t Islam. [25] X Research source Men, however, can marry women who don’t identify as Muslim (though they’re encouraged to convert their wife to Islam). [26] X Research source
